alert.note: Alert for Baker; Bradford; Union; Western Clay (Florida) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Jacksonville (Northeast Florida and Southeast Georgia)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued March 19 at 10:33PM EDT by NWS Jacksonville
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of central Nassau, northern Bradford, southeastern Baker, eastern Union, northwestern Clay, western Duval and south central Charlton Counties through 1115 PM EDT... At 1033 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Raiford, moving northeast at 30 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 45 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Lake Butler, Callahan, Raiford, Macclenny, Glen St. Mary, Maxville, Beasley, New River, Bryceville and Cecil Field. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with this storm. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
